We must keep Guantanamo Bay open and keep violent terrorists out of the United States.
House Democrats stripped this provision from the #NDAA because they are soft on terror and they want to close Guantanamo Bay. Our national security will suffer because of their actions.

As the former Chief of Detainee Operations for Multi-National Division North in Operation Iraqi Freedom, I know the threat these terrorists pose to our communities and families, as well as our national security.
This means that terrorists who are currently being held at Guantanamo Bay can be transferred to a neighborhood near you.
This year, House Democrats chose to remove the provision from the #NDAA and also blocked an attempt by @RepRalphNorman to add the language to the bill through the amendment process.
Every #NDAA since FY 2010 included a provision to prohibit the use of funds to transfer detainees from Guantanamo Bay to the United States.
For decades the #NDAA has been a bipartisan bill—even this year in the Senate their version passed 86-8. But instead, House Democrats chose to play political games with our national security.
This year, House Democrats chose to put partisanship in front of our national interests, our national security, and our servicemembers in their #NDAA.
Couldn’t agree more! https://twitter.com/RepBenCline/status/1149415196307447810 …
